rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment factually reports the confirmation of a case and scale without using high-potency language.
The segment uses a plain verb ('confirmed') and does not pair it with a moderate verb indicating impact, despite mentioning a number.
The segment does not contain any questions.
This segment reports confirmation of the virus and bird numbers but contains no explicit calming language or cues.
The segment does not contain a minimiser token ('only', 'just', etc.) combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
